description: Enable AI models to interact with Windows command-line functionality securely and efficiently. Execute commands, create projects, and retrieve system information while maintaining strict security protocols. Enhance your development workflows with safe command execution and project management tools.

capabilities.name: list_running_processes
capabilities.description: List all running processes on the system. Can be filtered by providing an optional filter string that will match against process names.

capabilities.name: get_system_info
capabilities.description: Retrieve system information including OS, hardware, and user details. Can provide basic or full details.

capabilities.name: get_network_info
capabilities.description: Retrieve network configuration information including IP addresses, adapters, and DNS settings. Can be filtered to a specific interface.

capabilities.name: get_scheduled_tasks
capabilities.description: Retrieve information about scheduled tasks on the system. Can query all tasks or get detailed status of a specific task.

capabilities.name: get_service_info
capabilities.description: Retrieve information about Windows services. Can query all services or get detailed status of a specific service.

capabilities.name: list_allowed_commands
capabilities.description: List all commands that are allowed to be executed by this server. This helps understand what operations are permitted.

capabilities.name: execute_command
capabilities.description: Execute a Windows command and return its output. Only commands in the allowed list can be executed. This tool should be used for running simple commands like 'dir', 'echo', etc.

capabilities.name: execute_powershell
capabilities.description: Execute a PowerShell script and return its output. This allows for more complex operations and script execution. PowerShell must be in the allowed commands list.
